title: 115_hr5137
content: The "Buy America 2.0 Act" requires the use of American iron, steel, and manufactured goods. The "Buy America 2.0 Act" mandates the use of American iron, steel, and manufactured goods for transportation or infrastructure projects funded by the Federal government, with exceptions allowed if it is in the public interest, if the materials are not available in the US, or if using US-made products increases project costs by more than 25 percent. The "Buy America 2.0 Act" requires Federal agencies to make waiver requests public for public input before making a decision. The Act must be applied in line with international agreements and does not override existing Buy America provisions if there is a conflict. The "Buy America 2.0 Act" mandates that Federal agencies must disclose waiver requests for public input before deciding. It aligns with international agreements and does not supersede existing Buy America provisions in case of conflict. Section 5323(j)(2)(C)(i) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to increase the percentage of rolling stock costs covered by federal funding in fiscal years 2021, 2022, and 2023. In fiscal years 2024 to 2026 and beyond, federal funding will cover an increasing percentage of rolling stock costs, reaching 100% by fiscal year 2026. SEC. 4 amends the Railroad Revitalization and Regulatory Reform Act of 1976 to include Buy America provisions for rail loans and loan guarantees. SEC. 5 introduces Buy America provisions for aviation. Section 50101 of title 49, United States Code, is amended to include Buy America provisions for components and subcomponents produced in the United States, with increasing requirements for fiscal years 2018, 2019, and 2020. For fiscal years 2020 to 2024, the cost of all components of the facility or equipment must meet increasing requirements, starting at 70 percent in 2020 and reaching 90 percent in 2024. For fiscal year 2025 onwards, the cost of all components of the facility or equipment must be 100 percent. SEC. 6. SAFE DRINKING WATER BUY AMERICA PROVISION. Amends the Safe Drinking Water Act to change funding requirements.
